definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Bungy and I had had an ambivalent relationship over years.
sentences.chinese: 我和邦迪多年来有着好恶参半的关系。

sentences.english: In doing translation, one should not alter the meaning of the original to suit one's own taste.
sentences.chinese: 翻译时不应根据自己的好恶改变原文的意思。

sentences.english: The two sisters share the same likes and dislikes.
sentences.chinese: 这两姐妹有相同的好恶爱憎。

sentences.english: We clearly have similar interests and likes.
sentences.chinese: 我们很明显的有着相似的兴趣和好恶。

sentences.english: Excellences do not depend on a single man's pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 某人某物是否优异不取决于一人的好恶。

sentences.english: Share what you are experiencing in terms of flavours and textures, likes and dislikes.
sentences.chinese: 分享你体验过的口味和材质，你的好恶。

sentences.english: A leader should adhere to the principle of justice, and can not act according to his own preference.
sentences.chinese: 做领导就要秉持公心，不能以个人好恶行事。

sentences.english: Bungy and I had an ambivalent relationship over years.
sentences.chinese: 我和邦迪多年来有着好恶参半的关系。

sentences.english: Excellences do not depend on a single person's pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 某人某物优异与否并不取决于某一个人的好恶。

sentences.english: Focus on the emotions, not the words, and stay calm.
sentences.chinese: 关注情感，而不在于言辞好恶，然后保持心态平衡。

definition: to appraise/to pass judgment on/to speak ill of/praise and censure/appraisal
words and actions/what one says and what one does
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
